gurmukhi: ਸੁਨਤ ਬਚਨ ੲੇ ਚੰਡਕਾ ਮਨ ਮੈਂ ੳੁਠੀ ਰਿਸਾੲਿ ॥
transliteration: Sounat Bachannde Channdaka Man Main Outhoo Roosaae||
translation: Hearing These words, Chandika was filled with great rage in her mind.

gurmukhi: ਸਭ ਦੈਤਨ ਕੋ ਛੈ ਕਰੳੁ ਬਸੳੁ ਸਿਵਪੁਰੀ ਜਾੲਿ ॥੨੩॥
transliteration: Sabh Daitan Ko Chhai Karau Basau Sivpuroo Jaae||23||
translation: She said, “I shall destroy all the demons, go and abide in the city of Shiva.23.

gurmukhi: ਦੈਤਨ ਕੇ ਬਧ ਕੋ ਜਬੈ ਚੰਡੀ ਕੀਓ ਪ੍ਰਕਾਸ ॥
transliteration: Daitan Ke Badh Ko Jabai Channdoo Ko( i)  Prakaas||
translation: When the idea of destroying the demons was given by Chandi;

gurmukhi: ਸਿੰਘ ਸੰਖ ਅੳੁ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਸਭ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਾੲਿਗੇ ਪਾਸ ॥੨੪॥
transliteration: Singh Sankh Au Astra Sabh Sastra Aaege Paas||24||
translation: The lion, conch and all other weapons and arms came themselves to her.24.

gurmukhi: ਦੈਤ ਸੰਘਾਰਨ ਕੇ ਨਮਿਤ ਕਾਲ ਜਨਮੁ ੲਿਹ ਲੀਨ ॥
transliteration: Dait Sanhaaran Ke Namit Kaal Janam(u) Eh Leen||
translation: It seemed that Death itself had taken the birth to destroy the demons.

gurmukhi: ਸਿੰਘ ਚੰਡ ਬਾਹਨ ਭੲਿਓ ਸਤ੍ਰਨ ਕੳੁ ਦੁਖੁ ਦੀਨ ॥੨੫॥
transliteration: Singh Channd Baahan Bhaio Satran Kau Doukh(u) Doon||25||
translation: The lion, who causes great suffering to the enemies, became the vehicle of the goddess Chandi.25.

gurmukhi: ਦਾਰੁਨ ਦੀਰਘੁ ਦਿੱਗਜ ਸੇ ਬਲ ਸਿੰਘਹਿ ਕੇ ਬਲ ਸਿੰਘ ਧਰੇ ਹੈ ॥
transliteration: Daaroun Dooragh(u) Diggad Se Bal Singhah(i) Ke Bal Singh Ddare Hai||
translation: The terrible form of the lion is like an elephant, he is mighty like a big lion.

gurmukhi: ਰੋਮ ਮਨੋ ਸਰ ਕਾਲਹਿ ਕੇ ਜਨ ਪਾਹਨ ਪੀਤ ਪੈ ਬ੍ਰਿਛ ਹਰੇ ਹੈ ॥
transliteration: Rom Mano Sar Kaalah(i) Ke Jan Paahan Poot Pai Brichh Dare Hai||
translation: The hair of the lion are like arrows and appear as trees growing on a yellow mountain.

gurmukhi: ਮੇਰ ਕੇ ਮੱਧਿ ਮਨੋ ਜਮਨਾ ਲਰ ਕੇਤਕੀ ਪੁੰਜ ਪੈ ਭ੍ਰਿੰਗ ਢਰੇ ਹੈ ॥
transliteration: Mer Ke Maddh(i) Mano Jamnaa Lar Ketakoo Pounj Pai Bhring Ddare Hai||
translation: The back-line of the lion looks like the current of Yamuna on the mountain, and the black hair on his body appear like the black bees on the flower of Ketki.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਨੋ ਮਹਾ ਪ੍ਰਿਥ ਲੈ ਕੈ ਕਮਾਨ ਸੁ ਭੂਧਰ ਭੂਮ ਤੇ ਨਿਅਾਰੇ ਕਰੇ ਹੈ ॥੨੬॥
transliteration: Maano Mahaa Prith Lai Kai Kamaan Su Bhoodhar Bhoom Te Nidare Dare Hai||26||
translation: Various sinewy limbs seem like the action of king Prithy of segregating the mountains from the earth by raising his bow and shootin with all his might.26.

gurmukhi: ਘੰਟਾ ਗਦਾ ਤ੍ਰਿਸੂਲ ਅਸ ਸੰਖ ਸਰਾਸਨ ਬਾਨ ॥
transliteration: Ghantaa Gadaa Trisool As Sankh Saraasan Baan||
translation: The gong, mace trident, sword, conch, bow and arrows;

gurmukhi: ਚਕ੍ਰ ਬਕ੍ਰ ਕਰ ਮੈ ਲੀੲੇ ਜਨ ਗ੍ਰੀਖਮ ਰਿਤ ਭਾਨ ॥੨੭॥
transliteration: Chakra Bakra Kar Mai Looe Jan Grookham Rit Bhaan||27||
translation: Alongwith the terrible disc-the godess took all these weapons in her hands; they have created the atmosphere like summer’s sun.27.
